item.title: Complete List of Tricks in Skate
item.description:
Players entering the city of San Vansterdam in EA's new Skate. Reboot will have a huge range of tricks to use at their disposal. However, remembering how to perform this huge list of maneuvers. Luckily, we're here to provide you with all the help you'll need. Along with showing you how to access Skate 's Skatepedia, we'll provide you with a complete list of every possible trick currently available in Skate .

Skate uses a special control scheme called the Flick-It System. Players familiar with the Skate franchise will know that this control scheme has been a key element of the series since it launched. This system is based around controlling direction with the left thumb stick, and controlling the board with the right stick. Our list will include the name of each trick, along with the Flick-It controls required to perform them.

How to Access Skatepedia in Skate

Skatepedia is the overall list of all tricks available in Skate. You can access this system by visiting the main menu and pressing X (or Square), and navigating to Skatepedia.

A Note on Stance: Remember that several factors, like Frontside and Backside, will depend on your stance. This will affect the controls considerably. Our character's stance is Goofy. If your character is regular-footed, the controls will be mirrored. Skatepedia will list all tricks based on your character's current stance.

All Basic Riding Tricks in Skate

Learn Your Skate Basics:

The controls for every trick on this list will be shown in the Classic gameplay mode. This can be switched to either Streamlined or Experienced modes in the Gameplay section of the settings menu. These modes will offer slight variations in controls. We are currently playing on the Xbox Series X. PlayStation players can use the following keys: A=X, X=Square, Y=Triangle, B=Circle.

Trick Name

Flick-It Control Input

Back-Foot Pushing

Press X

Front-Foot Pushing

A

Steer

Left Stick while moving

Kickturn

Left Stick while standing still

Foot Brake

B

Stand Mount

Y

Move Mount

Y while moving

Sprint Mount

X to sprint, Y to mount

Slide Mount

Hold B slide, Y to mount

Caveman

A to jump while off-board, Y to mount midair.

Dismount

Y while on-board

Advanced Board Actions:

Trick Setup

Body Spin

Frontside Prewind

Backside Prewind

Frontside Revert

Backside Revert

Manual

Nose Manual

Manual Revert

Speed Check

Frontside Powerslide

Backside Powerslide

Back Flip

Front Flip

Quick-Ollie

Fast Flick

Quick-Nollie

Fast Flick

Wallie

Just before hitting the wall straight-on

Frontside Wallride

Approach wall at Frontside angle

Backside Wallride

Approach wall at Backside angle

Hippy Jump

Press X+A

Transition:

Drop-In

Press Y at edge, then lean forward

Air-To-Flat

Hold Left Stick forward while in-air

Air-To-Lip

Hold Left Stick forward while approaching the lip of the ramp.

Lip-Trick-Entry

Hold Left Stick down while stalled on lip

More Tricks Coming Soon

More Tricks Coming Soon

All Flip Tricks in Skate

Ollie Tricks:

Trick Name

Flick-It Control Input

Ollie

Kickflip

Heelflip

Frontside Pop-Shuvit

Backside Pop-Shuvit

Varial Kickflip

Varial Heelflip

360 Flip

Laserflip

Hardflip

Inward Heelflip

FS 360 Pop-Shuvit

BS 360 Pop-Shuvit

360 Hardflip

360 Inward Heelflip

Nollie Tricks:

In Skate, the Nollie is when you use your nose to pop your tricks. Every basic trick you can do, you can do also do Nollie. The list of tricks is exactly the same as the regular tricks, except you pop off the nose. This means the direction of the flick is essentially opposite. We'll list a few tricks as an example, so you can see how the right stick functions. This also applies to Fakie, which is when you essentially ride backwards. If you are unfamiliar with skateboarding, it may be helpful to think of Fakie as 'Switch Nollie.'

Nollie

Nollie Kickflip

Nollie Heelflip

Nollie FS Pop-Shuvit

Nollie BS Pop-Shuvit

Nollie Varial Kickflip

Nollie Varial Heelflip

Nollie 360 Flip

Nollie Hardflip

Nollie Inward Heelflip

As you can see, the list of tricks is essentially the same, simply popped off the nose instead of the tail. Use the main trick list for the more complicated Nollie flip tricks.

Flip Trick Modifiers:

Late Flip

Perform the Right Stick action while already in the air.

Held Flip Tricks

For doubleflips or more, simply hold the right stick at the end-point of the Flick-It motion.

Boned OIlie

Hold the Right Stick forward after the ollie.

Front Foot One-Foot Ollie

Press A while in air.

Back Foot One-Foot Ollie

Press X while in air.

All Grind and Slide Tricks in Skate

Grind Tricks:

To execute grind tricks, simply approach any ledge at a slight angle, but almost parallel. When you approach a ledge or rail on your toeside, that will be Frontside, when you approach on your heel side, that is Backside. To grind, Ollie first, then apply the Flick-it input shown below.

Grind Name

Flick-It Input Controls

FS 50-50 Grind

Simply ollie onto the ledge. Requires no further input.

BS-50-50 Grind

Same as FS. Approach ledge or rail BS.

Frontside 5-0

Approach Frontside.

Backaside 5-0

Same action as Frontside, approached Backside.

Frontside Nose Grind

Approach Frontside

Backside Nose Grind

Same action as Frontside, approached Backside.

Frontside Crooked

Backside Crooked

Frontside Overcrook

Backside Overcrook

Frontside Salad

Backside Salad

Frontside Smith

Backside Smith

Frontside Feeble

Backside Feeble

Frontside Willy

Backside Willy

Frontside Overwilly

Backside Overwilly

Frontside Boardslide

Backside Boardslide

Frontside Lipslide

Backside Lipslide

Frontside Noseslide

Backside Noseslide

Frontside Tailslide

Backside Tailslide

Frontside Bluntslide

Backslide Bluntslide

Frontside Nose Blunt

Backside Nose Blunt

Exit Grind/Slide

Briefly hold Left Stick in the direction of exit.

More Coming Soon

More Coming Soon

All Grab Tricks in Skate

Basic Grab Tricks:

Grab Name

RT

Modified Grab Tricks:

Nosebone

Tuck Knee

Melon Grab

Method

Tail Nosebone

FS Shifty Tailgrab

BS Shifty Tailgrab

FS Shifty Nosegrab

BS Shifty Nosegrab

Double Grab Mod Tail

One-Foot Grab Tricks:

Frigid Air

No Foot Grab Tricks:

Airwalk

Christ Air

Ground Based Grab Tricks:

Frontside Ground Grab

Hold LT while riding

Backside Ground Grab

Hold RT while riding

Double Ground Grab

Hold LT + RT while riding

Coffin

Hold LT+RT+X+A while riding

Hand Plants:

Backside Handplant

RB at the lip of any transition

Frontside Handplant

Foot Plant Tricks:

Bean Plant

Hold RT and press A while riding.

Backside Fastplant

Hold RT and press X while riding

Frontside Boneless

Hold LT and press A while riding.

Frontside Fastplant

Hold LT and press X while riding.

More Grabs Coming Soon

More Grabs Coming Soon!

Remember that Skate is still in Early Access, so this is just the start of the list of tricks. The developers have made it clear that they intend to significantly expand the list over the course of the early access. As new tricks are added to Skate, we will add them here.

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games for Feeling Like an OP Wizard
item.description:
Summary

  • Open-world games offer a variety of magical abilities for creative fun and exploration as a wizard.
  • Elden Ring offers an Astrologer class that has Wizard-like abilities in a Soulslike experience.
  • Diablo 4 continues the legacy that started with the original Wizard.

Wielding the power of magic goes with fantasy video games like bread and butter, especially when given the option to play as a wizard , allowing the player to emulate the feeling of being a character like Gandalf from The Lord Of The Rings . It allows them to explore massive open worlds, bombarding every enemy with a lightning bolt or a beam of ice.

Open-world fantasy games, such as MMOs and action RPGs, let gamers fulfill their power fantasies by wielding mystical abilities. With a range of spells and magical weapons, players can embrace the role of their ideal wizard. Others focus on leveling up and upgrading, allowing players to attain godlike status through their magical abilities.

8 World of Warcraft

Still the King of MMORPGs After Twenty Years

World of Warcraft
8 /10
30
9.2 /10
Released
November 23, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Blizzard
Publisher(s)
Blizzard
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Many MMORPGs have come and gone, achieving varying levels of success. However, almost all of them have been influenced by World of Warcraft , which has been thriving for over twenty years since its launch. Whether players choose to go solo or team up with friends, Azeroth offers countless options for exploration and character creation, including magic-based characters.

The Mage class is the closest equivalent to a Wizard, and with the right equipment, such as a stave, players can truly embrace their Wizard fantasy in World of Warcraft . Whether someone is playing an Orc, Human, or a Draenai, they can unleash flashy spells with runic visuals, which put on a spectacle while dealing damage that can destroy powerful demons, undead armies, and Void Lords.

7 Avowed

Obsidian Entertainment Made Their Own World of Swords and Magic

Avowed
7 /10
39
7.5 /10
Released
February 18, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Xbox Game Studios
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
13 Images
Powered by

Set in the world of Eora, Avowed is Obsidian Entertainments take on the open-world fantasy RPG genre, similar to what they have brought to space sci-fi with The Outer Worlds . It gives the players a giant sandbox to explore, carry out quests, and experience an epic story filled with outlandish locations and magic, both light and dark. While it's not a fully open-world game, its large, open zones scratch that same exploration itch while offering a more focused experience.

One of the three main archetypes is the Wizard class, which allows the hurling of lightning from fingers, conjuring staffs made of magical energies, throwing fireballs, and much more. Its far from reinventing the wheel, but fans of magic-based characters will still enjoy unleashing mystical chaos in Avowed , especially since there are more options for light and dark magic than most games.

6 Elden Ring

If Dark Souls Was Set in a Massive Open World

Elden Ring
10 /10
70
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
From Software
Publisher(s)
Bandai Namco Entertainment, From Software
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
6 Images
Powered by

While there is no Wizard or Mage class specifically, the Astrologer class in Elden Ring is most proficient in Intelligence, Dexterity, and Mind, and they start the game with a staff. As a result, gamers have been able to mold the Astrologer into various kinds of magic users, from a magus to a sorcerer, which comes the closest to a classic Wizard.

An Astrologer is just one of many classes available in Elden Ring , which is FromSoftwares way of bringing their famously difficult RPGs like Bloodborne and Dark Souls into an open-world format. It still features a plethora of boss fights, and where most melee classes struggle, using magic has proven to level the playing field, with even the most powerful bosses struggling against spells (especially Comet Azur).

5 Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning

The Remaster of an Overshadowed Gem

Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning
7 /10
8.0 /10
Released
September 8, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
38 Studios, Big Huge Games, KAIKO GmbH
Publisher(s)
THQ Nordic
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PC, PS4, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

During a time when Skyrim was the biggest game in the world, Kingdoms Of Amalur: Reckoning was overshadowed, despite relatively positive reviews that praised it for being a fun RPG. With a large world filled with many quests and deep lore, it became a gem that would eventually get remastered as Kingdoms Of Amalur: Re-Reckoning .

Similar to Avowed , Kingdoms Of Amalur: Re-Reckoning is far from anything new, but the sorcery-based builds are fun to experiment with, as the game incentivizes experimenting with a mix of magic and weaponry of all kinds. With the right choices of upgrades, a lowly warrior can become strong enough to take on giant behemoths and evil sorcerers with ease.

4 Hogwarts Legacy

The Definitive Game Set in the Wizarding World

Hogwarts Legacy
9 /10
77
8.7 /10
Released
February 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Avalanche Software
Publisher(s)
Warner Bros. Games
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Avalanche Games surprised many with Hogwarts Legacy , which essentially allows fans of Harry Potter to live out their dream of being a student living at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. They get to create their own witch or wizard and experience an original story set a century before the events of Harry Potter and Voldemort.

As the player advances in school, the player learns more magic spells that can be used in the main story and out in the massive open world full of dark wizards and magical creatures. From Expelliarmus to the Three Unforgivable Curses, players can use many famous spells from the Wizarding World to advance and explore the grounds of Hogwarts and the Scottish Highlands that surround it.

3 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

The Dragonborn Can Be a Powerful Magic Wielder

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
81
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Publisher(s)
Bethesda Softworks
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
6 Images
Powered by

With the constellation system that allows players to craft any class they desire, magic can be used in many ways in The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim , including healing, elemental damage, or conjuring minions. That freedom, combined with hundreds of quests and storylines, not only makes every playthrough feel fresh but also helps establish the game as an iconic RPG.

There is the option to wield magic at the fingertips like a mage or battlemage, but there are also classic staffs and robes to create a wizard class. Whether it's fighting a dragon or clearing a dungeon full of bandits, unleashing powerful spells never stops being satisfying, especially when combined with the Dragon Shouts, which are another form of spellcasting.

2 Dragons Dogma 2

Vocations Can Turn a Mage into a Sorcerer

Dragon's Dogma 2
9 /10
17
7.0 /10
Released
March 22, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Capcom
Publisher(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PC, PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

On top of its stunning visuals, Dragon's Dogma 2 quickly establishes itself as an iconic modern-age RPG that has everything a high fantasy fan needs to enjoy, such as giant monsters to slay, a compelling story, and the chance to use magic. There is the Mage class, but the protagonist can evolve into a Sorcerer thanks to the game's signature vocation system that changes and diversifies the gameplay.

Dragon's Dogma 2 is praised for being a straightforward but addictive RPG despite a few shortcomings, taking the gameplay of the original Dragon's Dogma and polishing it. At first, facing off against dragons and other large creatures can be overwhelming, but Sorcerers offer a more damage-based class that can summon tornadoes, lightning chain attacks, and enhancements that allow players to become a ranged powerhouse while their pawns tackle enemies head-on.

1 Diablo 4

Spellcasting Has Been a Staple of the Franchise

Diablo 4
9 /10
107
7.5 /10
Released
June 6, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Blizzard
Publisher(s)
Blizzard
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Blizzard Entertainment helped set a new standard for action RPGs with the Diablo franchise, but with Diablo 4 , they took the isometric RPG template and gave gamers a fully connected open world. The regions can be traveled to without any loading screens, each with its own challenges and monsters to fight as a fully customizable protagonist.

With immense fidelity, Diablo 4 puts more into character creation, which includes six classes: Barbarian, Sorcerer, Rogue, Necromancer, Druid, and Spiritborn. The Sorcerer class is more or less an evolution of the Wizard class from the first Diablo , allowing players to unleash a barrage of magic spells, from conjuring hydras to becoming a living blizzard that destroys everything in their path. Diablo 4 is all about tearing through hordes of enemies, and the Sorcerer is no different, tearing a path through demons with powerful magic that does not relent.

item.title: Borderlands 4: How to Replace the Power Core in TASK Master Quest
item.description:
Borderlands 4 puts players at the center of the action and shenanigans that are suited to the larger-than-life personality of a Vault-Hunter. Right on the heels of pulling off a heist, players will get the "TASK" series of quests from one of the crew members, Kilo. She'll be sending players to empty Order Pods with loot inside. Opening these Order Pods will become increasingly difficult, and the last quest called TASK Master will have an additional step, replacing the power core.

How to Replace the Power Core in Borderlands 4 (TASK Master Quest)

The TASK Master quest is the final thief quest in Kilo's questline that players will be completing in Borderlands 4 . To unlock the TASK Master quest , they'll need to first complete the Main Mission 5: One Fell Swoop, followed by the Kairos Job, Free for the TASKing, and TASK and Ye Shall Receive side quests.

Once you've completed all the pre-requisite quests, go to Kilo, who'll be standing in the same position at the Launchpad Faction Town (Safe House) . She'll offer one last quest to players called TASK Master, which will send them off to salvage a downed Order Ship yet another time. However, the mission difficulty is marked as "Very Hard" this time around, but it's not in terms of combat.

Now, players will need to reach the location marked on the map to find a desolate Order Ship in a field, ready for the taking. This ship will have a similar layout of buttons and levers like all the previous quests, except for one new mechanic. There's a power core on the left side that players can pull from their grapple, which can make things trickier.

Before starting the button sequence, make sure to clear any enemies in the area . Since you'll need to follow Kilo's instructions and perform the appropriate action within seconds, any attack from enemies can disrupt it, forcing you to start from scratch.

Once you're done, you can start the Order Pod opening sequence in the TASK Master quest in Borderlands 4 . Here's the sequence of buttons and levers that you'll need to press to unlock the Order Pod.

If you fail at any stage of this sequence, you'll need to start the whole sequence again. However, there aren't any penalties for failing and restarting, so take your time until you get it right.

Kilo's Instructions

Your Action

Punch the Button (Start Sequence)

Melee the red button in the middle.

Flip That Switch

Flip the switch on the left.

Replace the Power Core

Grapple the Power Core on the left, and throw it into the circular slot on the right side.

Pull the Lever

Pull the lever on the right.

Don't Flip the Switch

Do nothing.

Press the Button

Simply press the red button (instead of melee).

Melee the Button

Punch the red button.

Shoot the Panel

Shoot the circular red area, right above the button in the middle.

Remove the Power Core

Grapple the already inserted Power Core on the right and throw it away quickly.

Do Not Pull the Lever

Do Nothing.

Shoot the Panel

Shoot the circular red area in the middle, again.

Flip That Switch

Flip the Switch on the left.

Smack the Button

Melee the red button.

Replace the Power Core

Grapple the Power Core on the left, and throw it into the circular area on the right, again.

Press the Button (X2)

Simply press the red button.

Press the red button again.

Melee the Button

Melee the red button now.

Press the Button

Press the button again.

Remove the Power Core

Grapple the inserted Power Core on the right and throw it away quickly.

Flip that Switch

Flip the switch on the left.

Pull the Lever

Pull the lever on the right.

Shoot the Panel

Shoot the red circular area in the middle, again.

Pull the Lever

Pull the lever on the right, again.

Flip that Switch

Flip the switch on the left, one last time.

Replace the Power Core

Grapple a new Power Core from the left side, and insert it into the circular slot on the right.

Once you've successfully followed through all of Kilo's instructions and interacted with all the buttons and levers, including replacing the Power Cores in the right order, the Order Pod will open up. Get inside and claim your loot, which will complete the TASK Master side quest in Borderlands 4 .

14
7.2 /10
8 /10

Borderlands 4

item.title: Where to Find Tannis Riding a Fish Easter Egg in Borderlands 4 (Cut That Out Achievement)
item.description:
The Borderlands series has a tradition of including several pop-culture references and character cameos as hidden easter eggs for players to find. Borderlands 4 upholds that tradition by bringing back the popular "Tannis on a Fish or Riding a Fish" easter egg from the previous games. Players will be able to discover this easter egg pretty early on in the game. However, they'll need to blow up some explosive barrels in a particular order for the easter egg and the Cut That Out trophy to pop up.

Where to Find the "Tannis on a Fish" Easter Egg in Borderlands 4 (Cut That Out Trophy)

Players can check out our Borderlands 4 interactive map to check out the location of all the hidden secrets and loot in Kairos.

Players can encounter Tannis on a Fish easter egg right after finishing the tutorial section of Borderlands 4 . After the prologue, you'll be at the Launchpad faction town, which is the first NPC hub area in the game. From here, travel west towards the shoreline to the location marked on the map above.

Once you reach the area, you'll spot a little hut on the beach, with five barrels of different elements scattered around it. Players will need to blow up said barrels in a particular order to trigger Tannis riding the Fish easter egg.

Since there are five barrels, there are 120 possible combinations to try if you want to figure out the order yourself. However, lets make things easier and share the correct order you need to blow up the barrels to trigger the Tannis on a Fish easter egg in Borderlands 4 .

Order

Color of the Barrel

Element

Location

1

Green

Corrosive

Leftmost barrel

2

Light Blue

Cryo

Rightmost barrel

3

Red

Incendiary

Leftmost barrel close to the ocean

4

Dark Blue

Shock

Rightmost barrel close to the ocean

5

Yellow

Radiation

Middle barrel close to the ocean

Once you blow up these barrels in the right order, a cardboard cutout of Borderlands 2's iconic villain, Handsome Jack, will appear first . This will shortly be followed by a cardboard cutout of Dr. Patricia Tannis will appear, riding on a fish. After a short display, the area will erupt in fireworks, and players will unlock the Cut That Out trophy in Borderlands 4 .

14
7.2 /10
8 /10

item.title: Video Game Characters Who Will Never Give Up
item.description:
Some heroes are born warriors, and others are more reluctant. Both sides of the fence could have characters that wont back down from a fight no matter for several reasons. They could be incredibly good, wishing to eradicate evil at its core. They could also just love the art of fighting.

Whatever the case may be, these characters are easy to cheer for as they embody the very best of what it means to be a hero. That doesnt mean theyre perfect, as even the best heroes have flaws, but theyre still magical. From across several genres, these are the characters players should strive to be like.

There will be spoilers.

Maelle (Clair Obscur: Expedition 33)

For Those Who Come After

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
156
9.4 /10
Released
April 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Maelle is one of the party members of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . Like the rest of the crew, she witnesses countless horrors between unseen monsters and comrades falling before her eyes. She also has to come to terms with knowing that she is the daughter of the very person putting this world into turmoil, her mother, aka The Paintress. Its more complicated than that, but despite every revelation that Maelle learns, she is determined to set things right for her family and the country, no matter what.

Zidane Tribal (Final Fantasy 9)

A Thief With A Plan

Final Fantasy 9
26
9.3 /10
Released
July 7, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

Zidane is the lead in Final Fantasy 9 , and hes a charismatic thief. No matter what happens to him or the party, Zidane has something clever to say, but he learns when to be serious and when its okay to joke around. Hes not aiming to be a typical RPG hero, but when the honor of world-saving falls into his lap, he doesnt run away either. He faces it head-on with the rest of his party, even after learning his brother is Kuja, the primary root of evil in the game. Zidane appears before his beloved Garnet in the ending one last time because nothing was going to keep them apart despite seemingly exploding in a previous event.

Zagreus is the lead of Hades and the only playable character, as is customary in a roguelike. Zagreus is the son of the titular Hades and lives in the underworld, but one day, he has had enough. He decides he wants to leave the underworld and see his mother on the surface, which Hades forbids.

Ignoring his father and the dangers within, Zagreus attempts to escape no matter how many times it literally kills him. Even after reuniting with his mom and dying as he cannot breathe surface air, Zagreus does not give up the fight.

Pit is the hero of the Kid Icarus series, which didnt demonstrate his true colors on the NES and Game Boy. Kid Icarus: Uprising was sort of like a reboot for the franchise and a great one at that, as Pit received a big upgrade in terms of personality and combat choices. Hes the type of plucky hero that spouts platitudes about good and evil and literally says hes never going to give up. His earnestness may come across as a bit cheesy, but its easy to root for Pit as his actions speak louder than words.

The Power Of Friendship

Sora, from Kingdom Hearts , and Pit would get along swimmingly as the two have a lot in common. Soras entire belief system is in his friends. For such a young kid, Sora goes through a lot. He witnesses his beloved Kairi get kidnapped, his best friend Riku turn to darkness, and he even gets his personality split after becoming a Heartless. Thats surface-level stuff that happens in the first game, but theres so much more to Soras story. His heart is the strongest in the series, despite his hardships, and its like a beacon of pure light that can guide anyone down the darkest of roads.

Ichiban took over as the main character of the Yakuza series in the seventh main game, Yakuza: Like a Dragon. His purity shone through in that game as he only wanted what was best for his friends and fellow Yakuza members.

Ichibans determination was showcased even greater in the sequel, Like A Dragon: Infinite Wealth , which found him waking up in a foreign city, Honolulu, thousands of miles away from his Japanese homeland. He uncovers his mom, whom he lost touch with, is in trouble, and stops at nothing to try and see her face one turn-based battle at a time.

Peter Parker is a hero who seemingly needs no introduction as Spider-Man in the comics has existed in the comics since the 60s. Still, new takes on the hero are always appreciated, like Marvels Spider-Man , Insomniac Games first attempt at redefining the hero. Like most iterations, Peter is a kind character who cares for his aunt, friends, and even volunteers at a homeless shelter. Even as a superhero, Peter never wants to kill anyone and will give his enemies the benefit of the doubt. This leads to an emotional showdown with Doc Ock, who went from a father figure to a villain in the blink of an eye.

Mega Man Trigger/Volnutt (Mega Man Legends)

Determined But Nice

The hero of Mega Man Legends can either go by Mega Man Trigger or Mega Man Volnutt canonically, but everyone just calls him Mega Man in the game regardless. This 3D action-adventure game did a lot for the character, who was more of a blank slate in his previous iterations on the NES and SNES. Mega Man gained a personality as a humble adventurer who didnt always know what to say, but meant well. He may not be the most well-spoken hero, but Mega Man knows the difference between right and wrong and doesnt give up, be it in the face of pirates trying to destroy the island or giant robots trying to destroy him in the dungeons.
